conclusion: We need to determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q placed at the midpoint between the two plates of a parallel-plate capacitor.
The image shows a parallel-plate capacitor with a positive charge +Q on one plate and a negative charge -Q on the other plate. A point charge q is placed at the midpoint between the plates.

The electric field E between the plates of a parallel-plate capacitor is given by E = Q / (ε₀A), where Q is the charge on each plate, ε₀ is the permittivity of free space, and A is the area of each plate.
The electric field E can also be expressed as E = V / d, where V is the voltage across the plates and d is the distance between the plates.
The voltage V across the capacitor is given by V = Q / C, where C is the capacitance of the capacitor.
Substituting V = Q / C into E = V / d, we get E = Q / (Cd).
The force F on a point charge q in an electric field E is given by F = qE.
Substituting E = Q / (Cd) into F = qE, we get F = q(Q / (Cd)) = qQ / (Cd).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q is F = qQ / (Cd).
